property.comment: What does this mappable element represent in the mapping context? This is used to filter the `Mapping Type Settings` that can be mapped to this element.
property.name: Represents

property.comment: Overrides the icon of this mappable element. Must return a `string`.
property.name: Icon Override

property.comment: Determines if the element should be displayed in the advanced mapping view.
property.hint: Filters whether this setting can be applied to the underlying element.
property.name: Filter Function

property.comment: Overrides the default text display of the element. This function can return a simple `string` or an array display components (i.e. `{ text: string, cssClass?: string }[]`)
property.name: Display Function

property.comment: If this function returns `true` this mappable element will be available for mapping. If `false` it will appear "grayed out".
property.hint: Determines whether this mapping node can be mapped.
property.name: Is Mappable Function

property.comment: Whether this element can be mapped to / from multiple times.
property.hint: Whether this type can be mapped multiple times
property.name: Allow Multiple Mappings

property.comment:
If an element is *traversable*, its type-reference's children are used to populate the children of this element. For example, a property of type `DTO` would typically be configured to be traversable so that the `DTO`'s fields can be mapped to / from.
* **Not Traversable** - indicates that this element is not traversable and it's type-reference should not be "explored" for mappable children.
* **Traverse Specific Types** - indicates that only type-references of specific types can be traversed. This set is specified by the `Traversable Types` dropdown which becomes available when this option is selected.
* **Traverse All Types** - indicates that any type-reference can be traversed.
* **Function** - indicates that the `Is Traversable Function` must be used to determine if this element is traversable.
property.name: Traversable Mode

property.comment: The set of types that can be traversed.
property.name: Traversable Types
property.isActiveFunction: // Traversal Mode == Traverse Specific Types return getProperty("6da92064-59ef-4361-8ad6-c73b54c18cc2").getValue() == "Traverse Specific Types";
property.isRequiredFunction: // Traversal Mode == Traverse Specific Types return getProperty("6da92064-59ef-4361-8ad6-c73b54c18cc2").getValue() == "Traverse Specific Types";

property.comment: This function must return a boolean `true` or `false` to determine whether this Mappable Element is traversable or not.
property.hint: Uses the element's type reference by default.
property.name: Is Traversable Function

property.hint: Uses the element's type reference by default.
property.name: Override Type Reference Function
property.isRequiredFunction: return getProperty("a6ec44d7-f928-4221-bed6-8589176a94c7")?.value?.length > 0 // indicate that there is old scripts that need to be converted.

property.comment: _OBSOLETE_ - Use the `Override Type Reference Function` instead.
property.name: Get Traversable Type Function

property.comment: _EXPERIMENTAL_ - Indicates whether mappings from elements should also update base properties on this element (e.g. its `Value` or a specific Stereotype Property).
property.name: Sync Mapping To

property.comment: _EXPERIMENTAL_ - Indicates which Stereotype the mapping value must sync with.
property.name: Sync Stereotype

property.comment: _EXPERIMENTAL_ - Indicates which Stereotype Property the mapping value must sync with. This must be the `id` of the Stereotype Property, since a dropdown for this is not yet supported by intent architect.
property.name: Sync Stereotype Property

property.comment: A script that is triggered whenever the mapping to / from this element changes.
property.name: On Mapping Changed Script
Validate Function

property.comment: _OBSOLETE_ - This is ignored.
property.name: Can Be Modified

property.comment:
This function is called when "automatic" mapping occurs on a traversable element (e.g. when a user double clicks a mappable element that automatically creates a new mappable element on the other end).
This function determines the name of the complex type that should be created as the type-reference for the newly created mappable element.
Returns a `string`.
property.name: Create Name Function

property.comment:
This option provides a way for this mappable element to reuse settings from other `Mappable Element Settings`. The child settings of the selected option will be added as child options to this mappable element at runtime.
Note that the selected option must exist in the overarching mapping context for it to be found at runtime.
property.name: Use Child Mappings From

property.comment: When automatically creating mappings that create new elements (e.g. by double clicking properties), the parent to create the new element is selected automatically. This function allows you to override that parent element and select one of its children. The function must return the id of the child element.
property.name: Override Map To Parent Function
